Description: Upper body fragment of Corinthian pottery closed vase. Panther (to right) and goat, confronted. The head of the panther, the horn, neck, and shoulder of the goat remain. Incision for interior detail and some outline. An incised rosette and small filled circles in the field. Added red on forehead of panther, neck of goat, and for bands above figured zone.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 16, no. 51 pl. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.905)
